text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen today 
I'm gonna make a much much requested dish called

kanom jeen namya now kanom jeen is a type of 
round rice noodles and Namya is the name of the

sauce that's going to go on top of these noodles 
now I like to think of these as the Thai version

of spaghetti because we serve cannot deal with 
lots and lots of different types of sauces and

it's got rid of the same consistency as pasta 
sauces so not too soupy and this particular

sauce that Nemea sauce is very popular in the 
south and I grew up in the south so I grew up

eating this all the time so I'm really excited to 
be finally doing this recipe let's get started so

numb yeah sauce is basically a curry thickened 
with fish you see how in a second I've got a pot

here with a little bit of water and I'm going to 
poach my fish but first I want to flavor well sort

of yeah flavor the broth with some herbs I've 
got some lemongrass that I've just smashed also

some galangal that I've slice thinly dropping 
those in now the most important herb though is

a chai so this is got Thai in English it's called 
finger root because it's sort of like the size of

a finger grow underground it has this beautiful 
cooling almost a little bit medicinal but in a

good way it's really hard to describe unless you 
smell it this is a fresh version that's really

really hard to find a lot of Asian grocery stores 
will carry the jarred ones sometimes their whole

like this one and it's just in brine and sometimes 
it's julienned and you can use those as well this

is actually a pretty good substitute if you can't 
find it just leave it out like there's really no

good substitute but I have to say that it is 
a major unique flavor in this dish so if you

decide to leave it out just know that the flavor 
will really be quite different at the end of the

day it's still going to be good it's just not 
going to be kind of ginam yeah flavor okay so

do look for that if possible just slice this up 
really roughly it's almost smells a little spicy

like a little peppery and so the fish so I am 
using tilapia for this and this is just frozen

tilapia we're gonna mush this fish up later so it 
really doesn't matter what you use just something

inexpensive and mild flavor okay just gonna 
let this poach until it's cooked alright so

the fish is done and you know it's done by simply 
just trying to break it off and if it comes off

easily then it's done now I'm just gonna take the 
fish and put it in my mortar and pestle yes this

is an interesting method for some of you perhaps 
these herbs are done I'm just gonna fish them out

but I'm saving the water cuz that water now has 
some of fish flavor and some of the herbs aroma

alright I'm just gonna let this sit and now let's 
make the curry paste so as with any Thai curry

paste we need some chilies so I'm using some dried 
chilies these are actually not Thai dried chilies

I don't have those right now but you can choose 
any kind the bigger they are the milder they tend

to be so these are spicy ish but not as spicy as 
it's hye-won so we can actually use more and what

I did is I cut them I took the seats out and I 
let them soak in hot water just for 15-20 minutes

until they're rehydrated and that just helped them 
grind a little bit better as you notice the seeds

will fall to the bottom if you don't want it spicy 
you just leave the seats at the bottom and the

rest of the ingredients are really classic curry 
paste ingredients such as lemongrass some galangal

and Miley if you want to throw in the herbs that 
you fished out from the fish poaching and throw

them in here you can as well nothing wrong with 
that some more catch eyes or some more finger

roots this time I've just chopped them up some 
shallots lots of shallots I don't think there's

a single Thai curry paste that I can think of that 
doesn't contain shallots and garlic turmeric and

turmeric I'm using fresh you can use a teaspoon of 
turmeric powder if you want now I'm going to blend

this but I'm going to add some of my coconut milk 
in here just to help it go I forgot to add my more

encouragement and that is fermented shrimp paste 
or guppy I really like it but you may think it's

a bit of a strong smell if you don't have it don't 
worry about it it adds saltiness and also really

like a punch of umami it really lifts the flavour 
that smells like come on feeding them yeah so now

I'm going to pour this into that pot that we had 
the fish watering earlier so I'm going to bring

my sauce to a simmer and now I'm going to add 
the rest of my coconut milk now the fish so got

my fish here my Morton pesto and I'm just gonna 
pound it until it's light and fluffy and that is

going to be my sauce thickener this is why you 
don't want to go with an expensive fish so now

I'm just gonna take all of my fluffy fish and add 
it to my sauce you know my guess is that back in

the day when people came up with this recipe it 
was a really good way of making a small amount

of fish stretch out a small amount of fish so 
everybody in the family can get a little bit of

protein look how thick and luscious that is so now 
I'm going to season this really simply with some

fish sauce but I'm not adding all of it just half 
of it because we're gonna let this reduce and you

know you just never know a little bit of sweetness 
to balance the saltiness with palm sugar all right

now let this simmer for 15 to 20 minutes you want 
to cook all the herbs and mingle and marry the

flavors and then we are so close to being done 
let's talk new dough so cannabis or to tender

round and sort of the size of a spaghettini 
so smaller than spaghetti I can't get fresh

condoms in here so I get the dry one okay which 
you can get in an Asian grocery store there are

a couple of sizes make sure you get the fine one 
and all I did was drop these into boiling water

for about seven minutes then I take them out and 
put them in a bowl of cold water that will wash

away the starch which make the noodles really 
sticky and also stop them from cooking then I

grab them and put them in a cute little bundle 
on some paper towel to help absorb extra liquid

and it'll also make them easy to portion out at 
the end because if they're in a big bundle then

if you're going to have a hard time trying to 
separate them out into different portions right

so like this you know one person can take two 
of these little bundles if you can't find this

there are a couple of options options there is 
something like this which is also rice noodles

and they come in little discs like this and this 
one is from Thailand actually it's dry condom tea

and it's actually made for kind of din but it's 
made from wheat okay the texture is similar to

the rice noodles so lots of different options here 
you really can't go wrong all right the sauce is

done and it smells fantastic I'm gonna give it a 
final taste oh just love love love that smell oh

so good mmm I gotta put some more fish sauce in 
oh it's got a kick whoo and I'm also going to add

some tamarind juice so how much juice I don't want 
this to taste sour but it will sort of brighten

up all the flavors final taste after adding the 
tamron mmm perfect oh so good I'm gonna grab just

a couple of bundles of my condom tea now these are 
at room temperature if you want you can heat this

up in the microwave or steam it and now kinome 
dean always comes with lots of different sides

oh the sauce on the noodles Oh like God look 
how good that is now I know it looks really

beautiful now but there's no choice but to just 
mess it all up there you go and I love making

my own because sometimes you go to Thailand and 
you know they try to save on cost and they give

you so little fish and the sauce is quite thin 
and runny when you make it yourself you can be

as generous as you want and I like it's rich and 
full of fish oh that's good Wow every time I eat

it I'm surprised how good it is and it's just 
such an amazing aroma of the combination of all

the different herbs the flavor from the Thai 
really comes out wow this really reminds me of

when I was living in happy.i because when I was 
growing up in the southern part of Thailand we

would go to a place that specializes in Panama 
Deana meow all the times when I eat this it

just brings back childhood memories and it's a 
really really easy curry to make so I hope you

give this a try this is not something you can 
find in most high restaurants so if you wanna

know what this is like you gotta make it yourself 
or go to Thailand so the recipe as always will be

unhappy eye-catching calm when you make it send 
me a photo on Facebook Twitter or Instagram

and I will see you next time for your next 
delicious Thai meal if you can't find it fresh
I have it somewhere somewhere
